sen.j: 忌部子人（いんべのこびと、生年不明 - 養老3年7月15日 (旧暦)（719年9月3日））は、日本の飛鳥時代の人物である。
sen.e: INBE no Kobito (year of birth unknown- (old calendar) March 15th, 719) was a person of the Asuka Period in Japan.
INBE no Kobito (year of birth unknown- (old calendar) March 15th, 719) was a person of the Asuka Period in Japan.
INBE no Kobito (year of birth unknown- (old calendar) March 15th, 719) was a person of the Asuka Period in Japan.

sen.j: 氏は「いみべ」「いむべ」とも読む。
sen.e: His clan can also be read as 'Imibe' or 'Imube.'
His surname can also be read as 'Imibe' or 'Imube.'
sen.cmt: この流れだと、ここではsurnameの方が適切だと思います。
sen.e: His surname can also be read as 'Imibe' or 'Imube.'

sen.j: 名は「子首」「首」とも書き、「こおびと」、「こびと」、「おびと」とも読む。
sen.e: His name can either be written as '子首'or '首'in Chinese characters and be read as 'Kobito,' 'Kobito,' or 'Obito' as well.
His name can either be written as '子首'or '首'in Chinese characters and be read as 'Kobito,' 'Kobito,' or 'Obito' as well.
His name can either be written as '子首'or '首'in Chinese characters and be read as 'Kobito,' 'Kobito,' or 'Obito' as well.

sen.j: 旧仮名遣いで読み方は変わらない。
sen.e: The reading of the name does not change when the old Japanese syllabary characters are used.
The reading of the name does not change when the old Japanese syllabary characters are used.
The reading of the name does not change when the old Japanese syllabary characters are used.

sen.j: 姓（カバネ）は首、後に連、さらに後に宿禰。
sen.e: His kabane (hereditary title) was Kobito, which became Muraji, and later on as Sukune.
His kabane (hereditary title) was Kobito, which became Muraji, and later on as Sukune.
His kabane (hereditary title) was Kobito, which became Muraji, and later on as Sukune.

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱のとき、大海人皇子（天武天皇）側について倭京を守備した。
sen.e: During the Jinshin War in 672, he sided with Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) and protected Wakyo.
During the Jinshin War in 672, he sided with Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) and protected Wakyo.
During the Jinshin War in 672, he sided with Prince Oama (Emperor Tenmu) and protected Wakyo.

sen.j: 682年に帝紀と上古諸事の編纂の一員となり、中臣大島とともに少なくとも編纂初期の執筆の中心になった。
sen.e: In 682, he became one of the compiling members of Teiki (genealogy of the Imperial family) and Joko shoji (matters of high antiquity), and together with NAKATOMI no Oshima, played a central role in the compilation at least in the initial stages.

In 682, he became one of the compiling members of Teiki (genealogy of the Imperial family) and Joko shoji (matters of high antiquity), and together with NAKATOMI no Oshima, played at least a central role in the compilation in the initial stages.
sen.cmt: at least を使う場合、played at least の表現の方が自然です。
sen.e: In 682, he became one of the compiling members of Teiki (genealogy of the Imperial family) and Joko shoji (matters of high antiquity), and together with NAKATOMI no Oshima, played at least a central role in the compilation in the initial stages.

sen.j: これは死後の720年に『日本書紀』として完成した。
sen.e: Posthumously, in 720, the compilation took the final form as "The Nihonshoki."
Posthumously, in 720, the compilation took the final form as "The Nihonshoki."
Posthumously, in 720, the compilation took the final form as "The Nihonshoki."

sen.j: 文武天皇の代に五位に昇進し、702年に伊勢神宮に幣帛を捧げ、710年には出雲守になった。
sen.e: During the era of Monmu, he was promoted to Goi (Fifth Rank), and in 702, he made an offering to Ise-jingu Shrine and became the Director of Izumo Province by 710.
During the era of Monmu, he was promoted to Goi (Fifth Rank), and in 702, he made an offering to Ise-jingu Shrine and became the Director of Izumo Province by 710.
During the era of Monmu, he was promoted to Goi (Fifth Rank), and in 702, he made an offering to Ise-jingu Shrine and became the Director of Izumo Province by 710.

sen.j: 従四位下。
sen.e: He was ranked as Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
He was ranked as Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
He was ranked as Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: 672年の壬申の乱のとき、大海人皇子に味方して倭（大和国）で挙兵した大伴吹負は、まず倭京を奪い、ついで北に軍を進めた。
sen.e: During the Jinshin War in 672, OTOMO no Hukei sided with Prince Oama and raised an army in the Wa Province (Yamato Province), and first seized Wakyo (the city in Yamato), then proceeded north with the army.

During the Jinshin War in 672, OTOMO no Hukei sided with Prince Oama and raised an army in the Wa Province (Yamato Province), and first seized Wakyo (the city in Yamato), then proceeded north with the army.

During the Jinshin War in 672, OTOMO no Hukei sided with Prince Oama and raised an army in the Wa Province (Yamato Province), and first seized Wakyo (the city in Yamato), then proceeded north with the army.

sen.j: 倭京とは、当時近江宮に対し、倭（やまと）にあった飛鳥の古い京のことである。
sen.e: Wakyo was an old city of Asuka located in the Wa Province (Yamato Province), serving as the counterpart to Ominomiya Imperial House.
Wakyo was an old city of Asuka located in the Wa Province (Yamato Province), serving as the counterpart to Ominomiya Imperial House.
Wakyo was an old city of Asuka located in the Wa Province (Yamato Province), serving as the counterpart to Ominomiya Imperial House.

sen.j: 進軍の途中、7月3日に、荒田尾赤麻呂が吹負に本営の古京（倭京）の守りを固めるべきだと進言した。
sen.e: In the middle of the march on July 3rd, ARATO no Akamaro advised Hukei to strengthen the defensive lines of the Old City (Wakyo), which is where the headquarters was located.
In the middle of the march on July 3rd, ARATO no Akamaro advised Hukei to strengthen the defensive lines of the Old City (Wakyo), which is where the headquarter was located.
sen.cmt: 本営が一つならheadquarter でいいと思います。Headquarters にする場合は、headquarters were…になると思います。
sen.e: In the middle of the march on July 3rd, ARATO no Akamaro advised Hukei to strengthen the defensive lines of the Old City (Wakyo), which is where the headquarter was located.

sen.j: そこで吹負は赤麻呂と忌部首子人を遣わして、古京を守らせた。
sen.e: Hukei then dispatched Akamaro and INBE no Kobito to defend the Old City.
Hukei then dispatched Akamaro and INBE no Kobito to defend the Old City.
Hukei then dispatched Akamaro and INBE no Kobito to defend the Old City.

sen.j: 赤麻呂らは、道路の橋板を取り壊して楯に作りかえ、交差点に立てておいた。
sen.e: By breaking off the boards of the road, Akamaro and others turned them into shields and erected them at the intersection.
By breaking off the boards of the road, Akamaro and others turned them into shields and erected them at the intersection.
By breaking off the boards of the road, Akamaro and others turned them into shields and erected them at the intersection.

sen.j: 4日に吹負の軍を破って南に進んだ大野果安は、八口に至って高所から京を遠望した。
sen.e: ONO no Hatayasu who was proceeding south by having defeated Hukei's army on the fourth, surveyed the Old City from a high point in Yaguchi.
ONO no Hatayasu who was proceeding south by having defeated Hukei's army on the fourth, surveyed the Old City from a high point in Yaguchi.
ONO no Hatayasu who was proceeding south by having defeated Hukei's army on the fourth, surveyed the Old City from a high point in Yaguchi.

sen.j: 果安は街区ごとに楯か並べられているのをみて、伏兵を疑って引き上げた。
sen.e: Discovering that shields were erected at every city bloc, Hatayasu left, suspecting an ambush.
Discovering that shields were erected at every city bloc, Hatayasu left, suspecting an ambush.
Discovering that shields were erected at every city bloc, Hatayasu left, suspecting an ambush.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』には他に子人の活躍は見えない。
sen.e: No other roles performed by Kobito are found in "The Nihonshoki."
No other roles performed by Kobito are found in "The Nihonshoki."
No other roles performed by Kobito are found in "The Nihonshoki."

sen.j: 天武天皇9年（681年）1月8日に、忌部首首は、連の姓を与えられた。
sen.e: On January 8th, 681, INBE no Kobito was conferred the kabane of Muraji.
On January 8th, 681, INBE no Kobito was conferred the kabane of Muraji.
On January 8th, 681, INBE no Kobito was conferred the kabane of Muraji.

sen.j: 首は弟の色弗（忌部色夫知）とともに喜んで天皇を拝した。
sen.e: Kobito and his brother Shikobuchi (INBE no Shikofuchi) happily bowed down to the Emperor.
Kobito and his brother Shikobuchi (INBE no Shikofuchi) happily bowed down to the Emperor.
Kobito and his brother Shikobuchi (INBE no Shikofuchi) happily bowed down to the Emperor.

sen.j: 天武天皇10年（682年）3月17日に、天皇は大安殿で帝紀と上古の諸事を記し定めることを命じた。
sen.e: On March 17th, 682, the Emperor ordered the compilation of matters contained in Teiki and Joko at the Taianden Hall.
On March 17th, 682, the Emperor ordered the compilation of matters contained in Teiki and Joko at the Taianden Hall.
On March 17th, 682, the Emperor ordered the compilation of matters contained in Teiki and Joko at the Taianden Hall.

sen.j: 6人の皇族と6人の他の官人の中に、小錦中忌部連首の名がある。
sen.e: The name of Shokinchu (the 11th Rank out the 26th hierarchical ranking system) INBE no Muraji Kobito can be found among the six royal family members and six other government officials who participated in the compilation.

The name of Shokinchu (the 11th Rank out the 26th hierarchical ranking system) INBE no Muraji Kobito can be found among the six royal family members and six other government officials who participated in the compilation.

The name of Shokinchu (the 11th Rank out the 26th hierarchical ranking system) INBE no Muraji Kobito can be found among the six royal family members and six other government officials who participated in the compilation.

sen.j: 忌部首と中臣大島は自ら筆をとって記録したと特に記され、中心執筆者であったことがわかる。
sen.e: It is noted with emphasis that INBE no Kobito and NAKATOMI no Oshima took up the writing process by themselves, making it clear that they were the central composers of the chronicles.
It is noted with emphasis that INBE no Kobito and NAKATOMI no Oshima took up the writing process by themselves, making it clear that they were the central composers of the chronicles.
It is noted with emphasis that INBE no Kobito and NAKATOMI no Oshima took up the writing process by themselves, making it clear that they were the central composers of the chronicles.

sen.j: これが『日本書紀』編纂の着手を意味すると考えられている。
sen.e: On March 17th, 682, the Emperor ordered the compilation of matters contained in Teiki and Joko at the Taianden Hall.
On March 17th, 682, the Emperor ordered the compilation of matters contained in Teiki and Joko at the Taianden Hall.
On March 17th, 682, the Emperor ordered the compilation of matters contained in Teiki and Joko at the Taianden Hall.

sen.j: 天武天皇13年（684年）12月2日に、忌部連など50の連姓の氏が宿禰の姓を与えられた。
sen.e: On December 2nd, 684, INBE no Muraji as well as 50 other clans with the Muraji title were granted the kabane of Sukune.
On December 2nd, 684, INBE no Muraji as well as 50 other clans with the Muraji title were granted the kabane of Sukune.
On December 2nd, 684, INBE no Muraji as well as 50 other clans with the Muraji title were granted the kabane of Sukune.

sen.j: 大宝 (日本)2年（702年）3月8日に従五位下の忌部宿禰子首は、従五位上に進み、これ以後官位を進めていった。
sen.e: On March 8th, 702, INBE no Sukune Kobito was promoted to Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) from Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade); from then on he kept being promoted up the court ranks.

On March 8th, 702, INBE no Sukune Kobito was promoted to Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) from Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade); from then on he kept being promoted up the court ranks.

On March 8th, 702, INBE no Sukune Kobito was promoted to Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) from Jugoinoge (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade); from then on he kept being promoted up the court ranks.

sen.j: 慶雲元年（704年）11月8日、従五位上忌部宿禰子首は、伊勢太神宮（伊勢神宮）に遣わされ、幣帛、鳳凰鏡、窠子錦を供えた。
sen.e: On November 8th, 704, Jugoinojo INBE no Sukune Kobito was dispatched to Isetaijingu (Ise-jingu Shrine)and offered heihaku, Ho-kyo Mirror and 窠子錦 (Kashinishiki) (?).
sen.cmt: 「窠子錦」の読みが中々見いだせません。「かしにしき」として入力しておきました。
sen.e: On November 8th, 704, Jugoinojo INBE no Sukune Kobito was dispatched to Isetaijingu (Ise-jingu Shrine)and offered heihaku, Ho-kyo Mirror and 窠子錦 (Kashinishiki) (?).
On November 8th, 704, Jugoinojo INBE no Sukune Kobito was dispatched to Isetaijingu (Ise-jingu Shrine)and offered heihaku, Ho-kyo Mirror and 窠子錦 (Kashinishiki).

sen.j: 和銅3年（710年）3月13日に、正五位下忌部宿禰子首は出雲国守になった。
sen.e: On March 13th, 710, Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) INBE no Sukune Kobito became the Director of Izumo Province.
On March 13th, 710, Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) INBE no Sukune Kobito became the Director of Izumo Province.
On March 13th, 710, Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) INBE no Sukune Kobito became the Director of Izumo Province.

sen.j: 養老3年（719年）閏7月15日に、散位従四位上の忌部宿禰子人は死んだ。
sen.e: In July 15th, 719, Sani Jushiinoyo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade, courtier without post) INBE no Sukune Kobito died.
In July 15th, 719, Sani Jushiinoyo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade, courtier without post) INBE no Sukune Kobito died.
In July 15th, 719, Sani Jushiinoyo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade, courtier without post) INBE no Sukune Kobito died.

sen.j: 『日本書紀』完成を舎人親王が報告したのは、翌年5月21日であった。
sen.e: It was on May 21st of the next year, when Imperial Prince Toneri announced the completion of "The Nihonshoki."
It was on May 21st of the next year, when Imperial Prince Toneri announced the completion of "The Nihonshoki."
It was on May 21st of the next year, when Imperial Prince Toneri announced the completion of "The Nihonshoki."

tit.e: Chronological list of the main events

sen.j: 天武天皇元年（672年）7月3日 - 忌部首子人が荒田尾赤麻呂とともに古京を守備した。
sen.e: On July 3rd, 672, INBE no Kobito defended the Old City along with ARATAO no Akamaro.
On July 3rd, 672, INBE no Kobito defended the Old City along with ARATAO no Akamaro.
On July 3rd, 672, INBE no Kobito defended the Old City along with ARATAO no Akamaro.

sen.j: 天武天皇9年（681年）1月8日 - 忌部首首が連の姓を与えられた。
sen.e: On January 8th, 681, INBE no Kobito was granted the kabane of Muraji.
On January 8th, 681, INBE no Kobito was granted the kabane of Muraji.
On January 8th, 681, INBE no Kobito was granted the kabane of Muraji.

sen.j: 天武天皇10年（682年）3月17日 - 忌部連首らが帝紀と上古の諸事の編纂を命じられた。
sen.e: On March 17th, 682, INBE no Muraji Kobito and others were given the order to compile materials contained in Teiki and Joko.
On March 17th, 682, INBE no Muraji Kobito and others were given the order to compile materials contained in Teiki and Joko.

sen.j: 冠位は小錦中。
sen.e: He was ranked as Shokinchu (the 11th Rank out of the 26th hierarchical ranking system).
He was ranked as Shokinchu (the 11th Rank out of the 26th hierarchical ranking system).
He was ranked as Shokinchu (the 11th Rank out of the 26th hierarchical ranking system).

sen.j: 天武天皇13年（684年）12月2日 - 忌部連が宿禰の姓になった。
sen.e: On December 2nd, 684, Inbe Muraji was given the kabane of Sukune.
On December 2nd, 684, Inbe Muraji was given the kabane of Sukune.
On December 2nd, 684, Inbe Muraji was given the kabane of Sukune.

sen.j: 大宝2年（702年）3月8日 - 忌部宿禰子首が従五位下から従五位上に進んだ。
sen.e: On March 8th, 702, INBE no Sukune Kobito was promoted to Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) from Jugoinoge.
On March 8th, 702, INBE no Sukune Kobito was promoted to Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade) from Jugoinoge.

sen.j: 慶雲元年（704年）11月8日 - 忌部宿禰子首が伊勢神宮に幣帛などを捧げた。
sen.e: On November 8th, 704, INBE no Sukune Kobito gave offerings to Ise-jingu Shrine.
On November 8th, 704, INBE no Sukune Kobito gave offerings to Ise-jingu Shrine.

sen.j: 和銅3年（710年）3月13日 - 忌部宿禰子首が出雲守に任じられた。
sen.e: On March 13th, 710, INBE no Sukune Kobito was appointed as the Director of Izumo Province.
On March 13th, 710, INBE no Sukune Kobito was appointed as the Director of Izumo Province.
On March 13th, 710, INBE no Sukune Kobito was appointed as the Director of Izumo Province.

sen.j: 官位は正五位下。
sen.e: His official court rank was Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
His official court rank was Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).
His official court rank was Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: 和銅4年（711年）4月7日 - 忌部宿禰子首が正五位上に進んだ。
sen.e: On April 7th, 711, INBE no Sukune Kobito was promoted to Shogoinojo (Senior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).
On April 7th, 711, INBE no Sukune Kobito was promoted to Shogoinojo (Senior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).
On April 7th, 711, INBE no Sukune Kobito was promoted to Shogoinojo (Senior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade).

sen.j: 和銅7年（714年）1月5日 - 忌部宿禰子首が従四位下に進んだ。
sen.e: On January 5th, 714, INBE no Sukune Kobito was promoted to Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
On January 5th, 714, INBE no Sukune Kobito was promoted to Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: 養老2年（718年）1月5日 - 忌部宿禰子人が従四位上に進んだ。
sen.e: On January 5th, 718, INBE no Sukune Kobito was promoted to Jushiinojo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade).

sen.j: 養老3年（719年）閏7月15日 - 散位従四位上忌部宿禰子人が死んだ。
sen.e: On July 15th, 719, Sani Jushinojo (Junior Fourth Rank, Upper Grade, courtier without post) INBE no Sukune Kobito died.
